Deprecated API

Contents

  • Deprecated Interfaces
  • Deprecated Classes
  • Deprecated Methods
  • Deprecated Interfaces 
    Interface and Description
    org.reactfx.EitherEventStream
    Since 1.2.1. The utility of EitherEventStream<L, R> over just EventStream<Either<L, R>> is questionable and probably not worth maintaining a special implementation. Let us know if you use it and your code would get much less readable without it.
    org.reactfx.InterceptableBiEventStream
    org.reactfx.InterceptableEitherEventStream
    org.reactfx.InterceptableEventStream
    since 1.2.3. Use individual suspendable streams instead, according to the desired interception:
    • Use EventStream.suppressible().suspend() instead of interceptable().mute().
    • Use EventStream.pausable().suspend() instead of interceptable().pause().
    • Use EventStream.forgetful().suspend() instead of interceptable().retainLatest().
    • Use EventStream.reducible(BinaryOperator).suspend() instead of interceptable().reduce(reduction).
    • Use accumulative(...).suspend() instead of interceptable().tryReduce(reduction).
    org.reactfx.InterceptableTriEventStream
  • Deprecated Classes 
    Class and Description
    org.reactfx.ReductionResult
  • Deprecated Methods 
    Method and Description
    org.reactfx.BiEventStream.flatMapOpt(BiFunction<? super A, ? super B, Optional<U>>)
    Since 1.2.1. Renamed to BiEventStream.filterMap(BiFunction).
    org.reactfx.EventStream.flatMapOpt(Function<? super T, Optional<U>>)
    Since 1.2.1. Renamed to EventStream.filterMap(Function).
    org.reactfx.TriEventStream.flatMapOpt(TriFunction<? super A, ? super B, ? super C, Optional<U>>)
    Since 1.2.1. Renamed to TriEventStream.filterMap(TriFunction).
    org.reactfx.EventStream.interceptable()
    since 1.2.3. See deprecation comment at InterceptableEventStream.
    org.reactfx.BiEventStream.interceptable()
    org.reactfx.TriEventStream.interceptable()
    org.reactfx.BiEventStream.split(BiFunction<? super A, ? super B, Either<L, R>>)
    See deprecation comment at EitherEventStream.
    org.reactfx.EventStream.split(Function<? super T, Either<L, R>>)
    See deprecation comment at EitherEventStream.
    org.reactfx.TriEventStream.split(TriFunction<? super A, ? super B, ? super C, Either<L, R>>)
    See deprecation comment at EitherEventStream.
    org.reactfx.EventStream.test(Predicate<? super T>)
    See deprecation comment at EitherEventStream. You can use EventStream.splitBy(Predicate) as an alternative.
